title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN ANTONIO — On a night when the game slowed to a methodical, defensive grind, one man operated on a different plane entirely. David Robinson, with the weight of a franchise on his broad shoulders, did not merely play basketball; he authored a masterpiece for the ages, delivering a performance of such staggering dominance that the final score—a 99-92 victory for the Detroit Pistons—felt like a secondary footnote to his historic achievement.

The Admiral commanded the court, pouring in a game-high 41 points on an ruthlessly efficient 15-of-25 shooting. He was an unstoppable force in the paint and from the perimeter, but his dominance knew no bounds. Robinson completed a legendary triple-double by seizing a game-high 22 rebounds and swatting away a game-high 7 shots, turning the lane into his personal fortress.

Yet, in a cruel twist of basketball fate, his singular brilliance was met with collective failure. The Spurs committed a game-high 9 turnovers, with Robinson culpable for 6, and the supporting cast failed to rally. While Robinson battled, the Pistons executed with a balanced, relentless attack. Terry Mills provided a crucial 19 points off the bench, and Grant Hill, despite an off-shooting night, orchestrated the win with a game-high 9 assists.

The result was a heartbreaking paradox: one of the most statistically magnificent individual performances in NBA history, hollowed out by a loss on the scoreboard. David Robinson did everything humanly possible, crafting a stat line for the record books, only to walk off the court a solitary, dominant figure in a defeat that defied belief.
